main event: Two unidentified objects were sighted over Capitol Heights, Maryland on October 3, 1953.
interesting points: The sighting lasted for approximately 20 seconds during the daytime,The objects were described as round and star-like in appearance,Each object was estimated to be three times the size of an average star or small grapefruit,The objects drifted apart and appeared independent of each other,There were no sound or visible trails associated with the objects during the observation.
sighted object: two round, star-like objects in the sky
witness description: capitol employees, one was a student at Maryland University
